description: Number of ways of dissecting a polygon into n hexagons.
comments: Also, with a different offset, number of colored quivers in the 3-mutation class of a quiver of Dynkin type A_n. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 22 2013
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: F. Harary, E. M. Palmer and R. C. Read, On the cell-growth problem for arbitrary polygons, Discr. Math. 11 (1975), 371-389.
Hermund A. Torkildsen, Colored quivers of type A and the cell-growth problem, J. Algebra and Applications, 12 (2013), #1250133. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 22 2013
mathematica: p=5; Table[Binomial[(p-1)n, n]/(((p-2)n+1)((p-2)n+2)) +If[OddQ[n], 0, Binomial[(p-1)n/2, n/2]/((p-2)n+2)]+Plus @@ Map[EulerPhi[ # ]Binomial[((p-1)n+1)/#, (n-1)/# ]/((p-1)n+1)&, Complement[Divisors[GCD[p, n-1]], {1}]], {n, 1, 20}] (* _Robert A. Russell_, Dec 11 2004 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: a(21) corrected by _Sean A. Irvine_, Mar 11 2016
